definitions.definition: To move or swing from side to side ; or backward and forward ; to rock .
examples: The trees swayed in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To move or wield with the hand ; to swing ; to wield.
To influence or direct by power , authority , persuasion , or by moral force ; to rule ; to govern ; to guide . Compare persuade .
examples: Do you think you can sway their decision?

definitions.definition: To cause to incline or swing to one side, or backward and forward; to bias ; to turn ; to bend ; to warp .
To hoist (a mast or yard) into position .
To be drawn to one side by weight or influence; to lean ; to incline .
To bear sway; to rule ; to govern .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move or swing from side to side ; or backward and forward ; to rock .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To move or wield with the hand ; to swing ; to wield.
( transitive ) To influence or direct by power , authority , persuasion , or by moral force ; to rule ; to govern ; to guide . Compare persuade .
( transitive ) To cause to incline or swing to one side, or backward and forward; to bias ; to turn ; to bend ; to warp .
( nautical , transitive ) To hoist (a mast or yard) into position .
To be drawn to one side by weight or influence; to lean ; to incline .
To bear sway; to rule ; to govern .
